title.narrative: Promoting Entrepreneurship through Capacity Building and Coaching (PECBC)

description.narrative: Strategic objective(SO)1: UPs programs are delivered efficiently and are contributing to the creation and improvement of entrepreneurship in the area UP is recognized as a competitive university in Rwanda Internal processes , management, transparency and accountability of UPU is improved and sustained. Strategic objective(SO) 2: SEC is recognized as the key point on UP for providing entrepreneurship services to students interested in business and supporting services to existing students initiatives. UPU methodology of using BPC as a tool for enabling business environment is proven efficient Strategic objective(SO)3 UPU become a significant facilitator between local business community and policy makers in improving conditions for private sector development and employment with stable communication channels between all stakeholders in the community.

This is a continuation of a 5 year project entitled Promoting Entrepreneurship through Capacity Building and Coaching, (PECBC) proposed and presented by Umutara Polytechnic to SPARK for funding. The project seeks to strengthen and build a strong M & E to monitor progress and achievements of 2011. The project will further aim at contributing to economic growth, job creation and poverty reduction. UP students in the Faculties of agriculture, engineering, ICT, Veterinary medicine and Commerce & Applied Economics will be encouraged to participate in UP business idea entrepreneurship competition whereby they will develop business plans with assistance from Umutara Polytechnic staff and other project stakeholders. Plans will then be reviewed by a panel of experts. Students with promising plans will Implement their plans under a nurturing program managed by UP with funds for implementation coming from Spark.
The project will cultivate a culture of entrepreneurship across UPs programs. The students entrepreneurship club will be strengthened while UP staff members will be empowered through training in general Master plan development and later facilitated to develop UP master plan, SME Development program and Business incubation. These trainings shall cover both teaching and non teaching staff. UP and other stakeholders will also lobby and advocate for favourable policies for graduates to start businesses. All the trainings will be delivered through a training of trainers approach which will empower some staff members to train others. To support these programs, there will be need for more ICT equipment, internet connectivity, and a mini library. Results will include viable agribusinesses, employment opportunities, favourable policies and empowered UP staff, students and youth in Nyagatare District.
